snippet: In the 20 years since their introduction, banner ads have ruined the appearance and usability of the web, perverted content and diminished privacy.
abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of The Art column asserts that Internet banner ads have ruined the appearance and usability of the web, perverted content and diminished privacy; holds that better alternative is employing native ads, which blend into surrounds on platforms like Facebook or Instagram, making them far less annoying to users.
lead_paragraph: In the 20 years since their introduction, banner ads have ruined the appearance and usability of the web, perverted content and diminished privacy.

headline.main: Fall of the Banner Ad: The Monster That Swallowed the Web
